author: Bit-Chaos
body:
Running powershell core 7.0.2 on CentOS 8 inside a ssh-session from inside Windows Terminal (again Powershell Core 7.0.2).
Steps to reproduce:
- start Windows Terminal (1.0.1811.0)
- open terminal (Powershell core 7.0.2)
- connect to CentOS 8 machine using ssh
- inside the bash-session (at the CentOS host) start tmux
- inside tmux start powershell core (pwsh)

Observed behaviour:
- first character on every line is missing
- cursor is jumping 2 places to the right, when entering the first character

Expected behaviour:
- well, like any other shell: display the first character and then do not jump

comments.author: Bit-Chaos
comments.body:
Just an update: I removed the posh-git (https://github.com/dahlbyk/posh-git) module from the powershell init script and then everything works as expected. So this seems to be a problem with the combination of tmux+powershell+posh-git and is probably more related towards the posh-git module and not powershell itself.
GitHub
dahlbyk/posh-git
A PowerShell environment for Git. Contribute to dahlbyk/posh-git development by creating an account on GitHub.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @Bit-Chaos Thanks for the update. You may want to file an issue in the posh-git repo then. I will close this issue as `Question-Answered`.
